sub_title: Full professor Text-mining, Information Retrieval and NLP with application specializations in LegalTech and eHealth
summary:
Johannes (Jan) Scholtes is full-professor, frequent public speaker, blogger and tech-investor focusing on the benefits of the AI and Data Science for LegalTech and eHealth applications. He is specialized in Natural Language Processing, Text Analytics and Information Retrieval.

Since 2008, he is full-professor holding the extra-ordinary Chair in Text-Mining of the Artificial Intelligence group at the Department of Advanced Computer Sciences from the Faculty of Science and Engineering at the University of Maastricht. See https://textmining.nu for an overview of projects.  

Since 2017, he assisted setting up LegalTech education for the Legal Tech Alliance, a cooperation between law departments of 11 Universities of Applied Sciences in the Netherlands. In 2020, he co-founded and created the curriculum for the Leiden Legal Technologies Program (LLTP) at Leiden University, designed to teach legal professionals how they can be more productive and provide higher quality services using technology in a defensible and transparent manner. 

In 2021, he setup the LegalTech bridge website to freely share such educational materials for LegalTech education (www.legaltech.com). 

Scholtes is senior research fellow of the Dutch School for Information and Knowledge Systems (SIKS). A Research School accredited by the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences (http://www.siks.nl/). 

Scholtes acts as Chief Data Science at iPRO/ZyLAB. Since 1989, Here was involved in deploying in-house e-discovery and intelligent information governance software worldwide, initially as founder and CEO. Later as Chairman and Chief Strategy Officer. Here, he worked with many high-profile organizations such as war-crime tribunals, government agencies, regulatory & law-enforcement organizations and corporates. 

From 2015 to the sale of the company in 2018, he was vice-chairman of MindDistrict, a company providing SaaS eHealth solutions. 

Before joining ZyLAB in 1989, Scholtes was lieutenant in the Royal Dutch Navy. Scholtes holds a M.Sc. degree in Computer Science from Delft University of Technology and a Ph.D. in Computational Linguistics from the University of Amsterdam. 

From January 2010 to December 2012, he was a member of the board of directors of the Association of Information and Image Management (AIIM), a leading authority for standards and education in Enterprise Information Management (http://www.aiim.org), he was president of the Benelux Chapter of the ACEDS (www.aceds.org) from 2018-2023, and a member of the advisory board of EDRM (www.edrm.net) at in the same period.

treasury_media.title: Home
treasury_media.description:
Technology, Artificial Intelligence in particular, is the future. Legal applications are no exception. We cannot stop this process, but we can make sure that it is done in line with accepted legal, ethical and computer science standards in our society.
Here, you can find course material, recordings, publications and other relevant content to create, implement, and teach your own LegalTech courses.

profile_positions.description: Extraordinary (full) professor in text-mining within the Artificial Intelligence group of the department of Advanced Computer Sciences from the faculty of Science and Engineering at the University of Maastricht. Maastricht University (UM) is an innovative, research-oriented and the most international university in the Netherlands. UM offers academic programmes on a wide range of themes, including Arts & Culture, Behavioural and Political Sciences, Business and Economics, Health and Life Sciences, Law, and Advanced Computer Sciences. Working on education and research in information retrieval, text-mining,  and advanced natural language processing.
profile_positions.title: Extraordinairy (Full) Professor Text Mining

profile_positions.description:
Search and categorize the patent landscape faster, easier and more accurately using knowledge graph AI: smart and defensible technology!

The patent industry is one of the most traditional service industries in the world. Foundations of the patent system have been laid in the 19th century and surprisingly little has changed after that. If the system was developed today, what would it look like? Are we just used to do things in a certain way without seeing the big picture and today's possibilities? Feet deep in the foundations of the patent system and eyes taking a fresh look over it, IPRally provides new technology to where it creates maximum impact. IPRally focus on automating tasks that steal resources of both inventors and patent professionals and help them achieve their goals faster and better!
profile_positions.title: Board Member

company.name: KNAW - Koninklijke Nederlandse Akademie van Wetenschappen

profile_positions.company: KNAW - Koninklijke Nederlandse Akademie van Wetenschappen
profile_positions.description: The Netherlands Research School for Information and Knowledge Systems (SIKS) is a Dutch Research School established in 1996 and successively accredited by the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences (KNAW). SIKS is a self-organized and self-financed network organization in which currently over 500 IKS-researchers, including nearly 250 PhD-students cooperate. Representing the vast majority of IKS researchers in the Netherlands, it provides these researchers with a platform for cooperation, information exchange and dissemination of knowledge.
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Fellow at the SIKS (School voor Informatie- en Kennissystemen - SIKS)

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for research, development and legally defensible application of data science and artificial intelligence in all of iPRO and ZyLAB's eDiscovery and Information Governance software.

IPRO revolutionizes the eDiscovery process by providing earlier, actionable insights before collection occurs, empowering legal teams to focus on what matters. We combine best-in-class governance and eDiscovery software with predictive analytics to give legal teams in corporations, government agencies, law firms, and legal partners the ability to conduct Early Data Assessment where the information lives reducing cost by more than 80% and slashing process time by more than 70%.
profile_positions.title: Chief Data Scientist

profile_positions.description: Leiden Centre of Data Science. The Leiden Centre of Data Science (LCDS) is a network of researchers from different scientific disciplines, who use innovative methods to deal with large amounts of data. Big Data is everywhere: a constantly increasing amount of data is being produced worldwide. Leiden University is a public research university in Leiden, Netherlands. Founded in 1575 by William, Prince of Orange as a reward to the town of Leiden for its defense against Spanish attacks during the Eighty Years' War, it is the oldest institution of higher education in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Fellow at the Leiden Center of Data Science (LCDS)

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the creation and teaching of the Leiden Legal Technology Program, a 4 course curriculum on technology for legal decision making, legal fact finding, legal big data and smart contracts.
profile_positions.title: Fellow at the Center for Professional Learning at the Faculty of Governance and Global Affairs

profile_positions.description: Empowering the global leaders of e-discovery, the Electronic Discovery Reference Model (EDRM) creates practical global resources to improve e-discovery, privacy, security, and information governance.
profile_positions.title: Member Of The Board Of Advisors

profile_positions.description: The Association of Certified eDiscovery Specialists (ACEDS) focuses on building an international community of e-discovery practitioners for the exchange of ideas, guidance, training and best practices.
profile_positions.title: President of the Benelux Chapter

profile_positions.description:
ZyLAB has been an innovative and strategic leader in eDiscovery and Intelligent Information Governance technologies for more than 30 years. ZyLAB’s deep experience and proven technology helps organizations to quickly and easily get control of vast amounts of data and tackle today's eDiscovery challenges allowing them to leverage it to increase productivity, mitigate risk, reduce costs, investigate matters and gain business insights to drive strategic business decisions. 

ZyLAB’s end-to-end eDiscovery platform is an easy-to-use solution that helps corporations and governmental agencies to deal with regulatory requests, high frequency eDiscovery, FOIA and Public Records Requests, investigations and audits.
profile_positions.title: Chief Strategy Officer and Chairman

profile_positions.description: Minddistrict is a secure, flexible and user-friendly ehealth platform with an extensive catalogue of online modules, diaries and questionnaires. Healthcare organisations use the platform and catalogue to provide digitally enabled therapy to their clients.
profile_positions.title: Vice Chairman

profile_positions.description:
AIIM is the community that provides education, research, and best practices to help organizations find, control, and optimize their information. The AIIM community has grown to over 65,000 professionals from all industries and government, in over 150 unique countries, and within all levels of management including senior executives, line-of-business, and IT. 

For more than 60 years, AIIM has been the leading non-profit organization focused on helping users understand the challenges associated with managing documents, content, records, and business processes. Today, AIIM is international in scope, independent, implementation-focused, and, as the representative of the entire enterprise content management (ECM) industry – including users, suppliers, and the channel – acts as the industry's intermediary.
profile_positions.title: Board of Directors
